2022 Gra Roku Best Party Game Winner

2020 Spiel des Jahres Winner

2020 Japan Boardgame Prize Voters' Selection Nominee
info.description: Players are assigned a random card to recreate each using different components. Players vote on which picture was recreated and points awarded for correct guesses. Most points after 5 rounds wins.
info.helpText: Instructions for use are in the game itself.

imageLabel.text:
T a s k







R o u n d

toolCanvasLabel.text: CANVAS. Recreate picture in yellow rectangle. Click and drag the mouse to draw. Use black to draw and gray to erase. Switch between the colors by clicking on the square below.

toolSticksLabel.text: STICKS AND MARBLES. Recreate picture in yellow rectangle. Move the sticks and marbles into position in the space above. Move the slider to rotate any sticks in the starting area. Use any number of sticks or marbles.

fields.text: You're about to reset the drawing. Are you sure?

clickRoutine: var color = ${PROPERTY colorMap OF $parent} getIndex ${PROPERTY activeColor OF $parent}

fields.text: You're about to reset the work space. Are you sure?
You're about to reset the work space. Are you sure?

toolCubesLabel.text: CUBES. Recreate picture in yellow rectangle. Move the colored cubes into a position inside the black square above. There are 3 cubes in each color.  You must use exactly 9 cubes in a 3x3 grid.

fields.text: You're about to reset the work space. Are you sure?

toolShadesLabel.text: SHADES. Recreate picture in yellow rectangle. The area above consists of 25 squares. Click on a square to change its color from white to black to dark gray to light gray.

toolShapesLabel.text: SHAPES.  Recreate picture in yellow rectangle. Move the shapes into position in the space above. Move the slider to rotate any shapes in the starting area. Use any number of shapes.

changeRoutine.Note: Choose the things you want to change.
Set the x value so that it will not change.
Determine the y values that will limit control for this slider.
If y goes above the maximum, set x to the maximum.

elseRoutine.Note: If y goes below the minimum, then set y to the minimum.
elseRoutine: var rotationVar = ${ySlide} - ${yMin} // If y is between the min and the max, calculate the value considering where its starting limit is.
var rotationVar = ${rotationVar} * 2 //Double the rotation so you get twice as much movement in the small space

slideButtonShapes.xLock Note: Use xLock at the x coordinate on which the slider will travel to prevent it from moving left or right. Use yMin to set the upper limit of the travel of the slider.  This will depend on where the slider is on the board.  Use yRange to set how far the slider can travel.  In this case, it is 360 so the setting will go from 0 to 360.

changeRoutine.Note: Choose the things you want to change.
Set the x value so that it will not change.
Determine the y values that will limit control for this slider.
If y goes above the maximum, set x to the maximum.

elseRoutine.Note: If y goes below the minimum, then set y to the minimum.
elseRoutine: var rotationVar = ${ySlide} - ${yMin} // If y is between the min and the max, calculate the value considering where its starting limit is.

slideButtonSticks.xLock Note: Use xLock at the x coordinate on which the slider will travel to prevent it from moving left or right. Use yMin to set the upper limit of the travel of the slider.  This will depend on where the slider is on the board.  Use yRange to set how far the slider can travel.  In this case, it is 360 so the setting will go from 0 to 360.

fields.text: You are about to begin play (or reset) the game for all players. Are you sure?

thenRoutine.note: If less than 2 players in seat, do nothing.

elseRoutine.note: Pick a random tool to start, then assign it to the first seat. Move through the sequence of each seats and assign the next tool in order.

zzRandomToolsRoutine.note1: Change toolNum at beginning of game so order will be random each time.

zzUpdatePropertiesRoutine.note: Get and set properties for activeCount, activeNames, and activeSeats. Create result creator label.

fields.text: You're about to reset the work space. Are you sure?
Once submitted, you cannot make changes. Are you sure?

scoringLabel.text: SCORING. Guess which picture was created by the player whose name is glowing. The grid coordinates for the picture you were assigned still show above, but more than one player could have the same image. If this is not your creation, click on the x's below to change guess then press 'Enter.'

scoreCover2.text: Waiting for other players to guess

fields.text: You are about to submit your guess. You cannot change your answer after continuing. Are you sure?

clickRoutine: var thisGuess = ${PROPERTY text OF $thisCol} + ${PROPERTY text OF $thisRow}

clickRoutine.note: Reset the voting/guessing buttons to their default dashes.
Erase any existing image in the guessing area.

scoreseat1.css: color: white;font-size: 27px; text-align:center;border: 2px solid white;background: green; border-radius: 100%;

playersNeededLabel.text:
At least 2 players must be seated in order to start game.

At least 3 are needed for proper scorekeeping.

After players are seated, press 'Play' in the upper left corner to start.

clickRoutine: var outlineArray = push ${PROPERTY id OF seat1}
var outlineArray = push ${PROPERTY id OF seat2}
var outlineArray = push ${PROPERTY id OF seat3}
var outlineArray = push ${PROPERTY id OF seat4}
var outlineArray = push ${PROPERTY id OF seat5}

clickRoutine.note: Get all the tools and set them offscreen
Turn off activeGuess and turn for all seats.
Get the index of the seat to be evaluated.

clickRoutine: var indexLength = length ${indexArray} //get length of index (number of players)
var indexLength = ${indexLength} + 1 //add 1 so the math to figure out if we are on the last one works
var posIndex = ${PROPERTY posIndex} //this is the position in the index we will be working with for this guess
var currIndex = ${indexArray.$posIndex} //convert the index position into a specific seat

clickRoutine.note: Get the active tool for that seat.
Get the tool to be guessed on and move it on screen and set vis so all can see.
Cover the bottom area with the guessing materials.
Set rotation of leftover materials to 0 so they will not peek out from bottom.
Get the seat associated with this tool and turn it on.
Call the routine that hides the guessing label for the player that created this drawing.

clickRoutine.Note: This is where to start the wrap up stuff

clickRoutine: var posIndex = ${posIndex} + 1 //increase the position number to start with the next seat next time

clickRoutine.note: If this is the last item in the array, set index back to 0

zzHideGuessForActiveRoutine.note: This routine will hide the scoring/guessing label for the player that made the current tool/drawing.

submitCountChangeRoutine.note: This routine checks to see if all players have submitted their drawings.  If so, it clicks this button and hides the outlines around the pictures.

elseRoutine.note: This routine checks to see if all the players have entered their vote/guess. If so, then ....
Check to see if number of guesses is one less than the number of players.  If so, then  ....

thenRoutine.note: Check to see if all the drawings have been voted/guessed on.  If so, then do nothing and let scoredCountChangeRoutine handle the rest. Otherwise, click this button.
This fires when the voting is over for each tool.  It displays a button to move to the next drawing to be voted on. I could not figure out a way to get this to work without a separate button.

scoredCountChangeRoutine.note: This routine checks to see if all the drawings have been scored for this round.

thenRoutine.note: Move the scoringLabel off the screen.
Transfer the temporary score held in a property of each seat to the label above the seat so players can see the scores.
If all the voting is display the results.

textChangeRoutine.note: This shouldn't be necessary but for some reason it is. It isn't needed in the other creatorLabels.  Just this one
